item.title: 维珍航空再订购七架空中客车 A330neos
item.description: 维珍航空周二在范堡罗航展上表示，该公司已再订购七架空中客车 A330-900 飞机。【原文：Virgin Atlantic has ordered a further seven Airbus A330-900 planes, the airline said at the Farnborough Airshow on Tuesday.】

item.title: 因电池起火风险，Stellantis 将在美国召回约 1.95 万辆混合动力汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周二表示，Stellantis公司将在美国召回19516辆混合动力汽车，因为这些汽车的电池组在停车时可能会导致车辆起火。【原文：Stellantis is recalling 19,516 hybrid vehicles in the U.S. as their battery pack may cause a vehicle fire when parked, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Grab 收购新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope
item.description: 据东南亚最大的叫车和送餐公司 Grab 和新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope 周二确认，两家公司已收购新加坡餐饮预订平台 Chope，具体价格未透露。【原文：Grab , Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing and food delivery firm, has bought Singaporean dining reservation platform Chope for an undisclosed price, according to confirmation from both companies on Tuesday.】

item.title: Forvia 和比亚迪将在欧洲建立亚洲合作伙伴关系
item.description: 世界第七大汽车零部件供应商福维亚公司周二表示，将把与中国电池专家和汽车制造商比亚迪的合作带到欧洲。【原文：The world's seventh largest car parts supplier Forvia will bring its partnership with Chinese battery specialist and car maker BYD to Europe, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 丰田将以 51.6 亿美元要约收购自身股份
item.description: 此次回购是在东京证券交易所推动治理，促使各大公司解除交叉持股的背景下进行的。【原文：The buyback comes amid a governance push by the Tokyo Stock Exchange that has prompted major companies to unwind cross-shareholdings.】

item.title: 江森自控将以 67 亿美元向博世出售暖通资产
item.description: 江森自控国际公司（JCI）周二表示，将以 67 亿美元的价格向德国博世集团出售其暖通设备组合。【原文：Johnson Controls International (JCI) said on Tuesday that it will sell a portfolio of its heating and ventilation units to Germany's Bosch Group for $6.7 billion.】

item.title: 高盛收购澳大利亚物流地产，加强房地产投资组合
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group）的另类投资平台周二表示，该公司在澳大利亚购买了七处以物流为主的物业，以扩大其房地产投资组合。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group's alternative investments platform said on Tuesday it bought seven logistics-focused properties across Australia to scale up its real estate portfolio.】

item.title: 大众汽车在中国市场陷入困境。电动汽车能否帮助它在美国实现增长？
item.description: 上个月，大众汽车集团向美国电动卡车和 SUV 制造商 Rivian 投资 50 亿美元，该公司股价因现金注入而飙升。【原文：When Volkswagen Group last month invested $5 billion in U.S. electric truck-and-SUV maker Rivian , the startup's shares soared on the cash infusion.】

item.title: 日本内阁官房长官呼吁广泛涨薪
item.description: 日本政府最高发言人 Yoshimasa Hayashi 表示，扩大小型企业的加薪范围至关重要，这凸显了政府为实现持续工资增长所做的努力。【原文：Broadening pay hikes among smaller firms is crucial, said Japan's top government spokesperson, Yoshimasa Hayashi, underscoring the administration's drive to achieve sustained wage gains.】

item.title: 泰国今年迄今已接待 1960 万外国游客
item.description: 泰国旅游部周二表示，1 月至 7 月 21 日期间，泰国共接待了 1960 万外国游客，比去年同期增长了 34%。【原文：Thailand recorded 19.6 million foreign tourist arrivals from January to July 21 period, the Tourism Ministry said Tuesday, up 34% from the same period a year earlier.】

item.title: 美国股市平静中的裂痕提升了投资组合保护的诱惑力
item.description: 由于美股面临政治不确定性、巨额科技收益和季节性疲软，投资者正寻求投资组合的保护，以避免美股在一段时期内可能出现的波动。【原文：Investors are eyeing portfolio protection from a potentially rough stretch in U.S. stocks as they face political uncertainty, big tech earnings and seasonal weakness.】

item.title: Cryptoverse：就像没有收益的债券？投资者对以太坊 ETF 持不同看法
item.description: 以太坊要摆脱比特币的阴影可能还需要一点时间。【原文：It may take a little more time for ether to edge out of bitcoin's shadow.】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛银行任命高盛高管为新任首席执行官
item.description: 瑞士私人银行瑞士宝盛周二表示，已聘请高盛（Goldman Sachs）合伙人斯特凡-博林格（Stefan Bollinger）担任新任首席执行官。【原文：Julius Baer has hired Goldman Sachs partner Stefan Bollinger to be its new chief executive, the Swiss private bank said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国关税威胁迫在眉睫，G20 聚焦数字税务谈判
item.description: 有关全球税收协议的谈判已远远超过了 6 月 30 日的最后期限，各国政府现在正期待着本周举行的 20 国集团财政领导人会议能在重新分配大型跨国公司征税权这一停滞不前的计划上取得进展。【原文：Talks over a global tax deal are continuing well past a June 30 deadline and governments are now looking to a Group of 20 finance leaders meeting this week for progress on a stalled plan to reallocate taxing rights on large multinational companies.】

item.title: 中国企业创纪录发行 140 亿美元可转债，市场重现活力
item.description: 今年迄今为止，中国的顶级公司已创纪录地筹集了 140 亿美元的离岸可转换债券，以在利率居高不下的情况下分散未来的资金需求。【原文：China's top companies have raised a record $14 billion in offshore convertible bonds so far this year as they diversify future funding needs while interest rates stay high.】

item.title: 早间竞购：特斯拉和 Alphabet 财报成为焦点
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 数据中心公司 Equinix 进军菲律宾，着眼于东南亚地区
item.description: 全球数据中心公司 Equinix 周二表示，已从 Total Information Management 收购了菲律宾的三个数据中心，以扩大其在东南亚这一高增长潜力地区的业务。【原文：Equinix has acquired three data centers in the Philippines from Total Information Management to expand its presence in the high growth potential region of Southeast Asia, the global data center firm said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 上半年中国城镇新增就业 698 万人
item.description: 中国人力资源部周二表示，今年上半年新增城镇就业 698 万人。【原文：China said on Tuesday that it added 6.98 million urban new jobs in the first half of the year, according to the human resources ministry.】

item.title: 备忘录称，网络安全公司 Wiz 放弃与谷歌达成的 230 亿美元交易
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份 Wiz 备忘录，网络安全初创公司 Wiz 放弃了谷歌母公司 Alphabet 230 亿美元的收购交易，并选择按最初计划进行首次公开募股。【原文：Cybersecurity startup Wiz has walked away from a reported $23 billion deal to be acquired by Google-parent Alphabet and has chosen to pursue an initial public offering as it initially planned, according to a Wiz memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 菲律宾将开始结束境外博彩中心的运营
item.description: 菲律宾博彩业监管机构周二表示，将吊销境外博彩公司的执照，并与执法机构合作执行小费迪南德-马科斯总统关于全面禁止博彩业的命令。【原文：The Philippines' gaming regulator said on Tuesday it will cancel the licenses of offshore gambling firms and work with law enforcement agencies to implement President Ferdinand Marcos Jr's order of a total ban on the industry.】

item.title: 国媒称中国调整贷款抵押将缓解 "资产荒
item.description: 中国国家媒体周二援引消息人士的话报道称，中国央行降低中期贷款抵押品要求的决定将缓解债券市场的 "资产饥荒 "压力。【原文：China's central bank's decision to lower the collateral requirement for medium-term loans will alleviate the "asset famine" pressure on the bond market, state media reported on Tuesday, citing a source.】

item.title: 尽管中美关系日趋紧张，制药巨头仍盯上中国交易
item.description: 业内高管和投资银行家表示，一些全球最大的制药商并没有被日益加剧的中美紧张局势所吓倒，它们正在中国寻求交易，以补充药品管线，并提升其在全球第二大医药市场的影响力。【原文：Some of the biggest global drugmakers, undeterred by mounting Sino-U.S. tensions, are scouring for deals in China to replenish drug pipelines and boost their presence in the world's second-biggest pharmaceutical market, industry executives and investment bankers said.】

item.title: 芯片股反弹，亚洲股市结束连跌走势
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市从一个月的低点反弹，台湾股市结束了连续五天的跌势，原因是半导体股从华尔街的复苏中率先反弹，而大宗商品价格下挫则拖累了澳元。【原文：Asian stocks bounced from one-month lows on Tuesday, with Taiwan's market snapping a five-day losing streak as semiconductor shares took a lead from a Wall Street recovery, while sagging commodity prices weighed on the Aussie dollar.】

item.title: 韩国第二季度经济增长可能大幅放缓
item.description: 路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，在经历了一年多的温和扩张之后，韩国上一季度的经济增长可能放缓至接近停滞，原因是尽管出口强劲，但借贷成本上升抑制了国内需求。【原文：After more than a year of moderate expansion, South Korea's economic growth likely slowed to a near halt last quarter as higher borrowing costs held back domestic demand despite robust exports, a Reuters poll of economists found.】

item.title: 澳元、新西兰元因中国降息而挣扎；美元漂泊不定
item.description: 周二，澳元和新西兰元在中国下调几项关键利率后在数周低点附近徘徊，美元则变化不大，等待新的推动力。【原文：The Australian and New Zealand dollars languished near multi-week lows on Tuesday after China's move to cut several key interest rates, while the dollar was little changed as it awaited fresh impetus.】

item.title: 预测原油库存膨胀、需求疲软，油价下跌
item.description: 周二，油价连续第三个交易日下滑，原因是投资者关注石油供应膨胀和需求疲软的前景，同时对美国总统竞选活动的动荡反应甚微。【原文：Oil prices slipped for a third trading session on Tuesday as investors focused on the prospect of swelling oil supplies and weak demand, while showing little reaction to U.S. presidential campaign upheaval.】

item.title: 印度在大选后的首份预算中重点关注创造就业和农村地区
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）周二在上月政府选举受挫后公布的 2024/25 年度财政预算中表示，印度将在未来五年斥资 240 亿美元用于促进就业和增加农村支出。【原文：India will spend $24 billion in job-spurring efforts over the next five years and boost rural spending, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday in the 2024/25 budget, unveiled after last month's election setback for the government.】

item.title: 美国奥委会就商标问题起诉洛根-保罗的饮料公司
item.description: 美国奥林匹克和残疾人奥林匹克委员会起诉了由 YouTube 名人洛根-保罗和 KSI 创办的运动饮料制造商 Prime Hydration，指控该公司以美国篮球队球员凯文-杜兰特为主角的奥运主题广告侵犯了其商标权。【原文：The U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Committee has sued sports drink maker Prime Hydration, founded by YouTube personalities Logan Paul and KSI, for allegedly violating its trademark rights with an Olympic-themed ad campaign featuring Team USA basketball player Kevin Durant.】

item.title: 保时捷调整财年展望，警告合金供应短缺将导致减值
item.description: 保时捷周二将其今年的销售预期下调至 390 亿至 400 亿欧元（约合 435.6 亿美元），并警告说，由于铝合金供应短缺影响了多家供应商，生产将出现减值。【原文：Porsche on Tuesday lowered its sales forecast for the year to between 39 billion and 40 billion euros ($43.56 billion) and warned of impairments in production spurred by a supply shortage of aluminium alloys impacting various suppliers.】

item.title: 谷歌取消从 Chrome 浏览器中移除 Cookie 的计划
item.description: 谷歌周一表示，它计划在其 Chrome 浏览器中保留第三方 Cookie，在此之前，谷歌曾多年承诺逐步淘汰这种用于在互联网上跟踪用户的微小代码包。【原文：Google is planning to keep third-party cookies in its Chrome browser, it said on Monday, after years of pledging to phase out the tiny packets of code meant to track users on the internet.】
